news_header: The Justice Department has ordered federal prosecutors to drop corruption charges against New York Mayor Eric Adams, citing inappropriate timing related to his upcoming mayoral campaign.
news_original_title: New Yorkin pormestaria Eric Adamsia vastaan nostetuista rikossyytteistä luovutaan – taustalla oikeusministeriön pyyntö
news_text: The request was signed by two federal prosecutors and Deputy Justice Minister Emil Bove, who argued that the charges distracted Adams from addressing immigration issues and violent crime. Adams claims the charges are politically motivated, linked to his criticism of former President Trump's immigration policies. He is facing allegations of campaign funding irregularities connected to the Turkish administration.
